thread.title: Brother of US journo held in Iran condemns 'cruel' detention
thread.title_full: Brother of US journo held in Iran condemns 'cruel' detention - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Brother of US journo held in Iran condemns 'cruel' detention
text:
WASHINGTON (AP) - The brother of the Washington Post journalist detained in Iran and convicted in secret described his brother, Jason Rezaian's (reh-ZY'-ahnz), imprisonment as "cruel and inhumane" and called on the U.S. government to take "any appropriate actions" to win his freedom.
Ali Rezaian told The Associated Press in Washington Tuesday that there was no evidence that his brother tried to access security information. He described the charges against the journalist as "trumped up."
Iran's judiciary spokesman confirmed the verdict on state TV Sunday, but gave no indication of what punishment the 39-year-old Iranian-American could face.
Ali Rezaian said the family has received no information about the verdict.
Jason Rezaian has been detained in Iran for 14 months on charges including espionage. He reportedly faces up to 20 years in prison.
